Description: Lip, wall, foot and handle sherd (mended from nine fragments) of East Greek pottery rosette or lotus bowl; fine orange clay with much silver mica; interior glazed with three sets of red band lined in white; exterior: sets of verticals on either side of handle; two bands below; outer face of handle and of foot painted black; the rest of the outside and the underside reserved.
Curator's comments: Fragments were also registered in error as 1924,1201.887, 890 and 895. All are seen in the drawing in the 1886 registration.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.289)
